entry.title: Hydrologic Outlook issued August 11 at 10:28AM ChST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WETTER WEATHER POSSIBLE NEXT WEEK... This Hydrologic Outlook is for Guam, Rota, Tinian and Saipan in the Mariana Islands. A series of passing disturbances could bring periods of heavy rain to the above islands from Monday August 15th to Friday August 19th. Sufficient heavy rain could cause urban and small stream flooding.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 11 at 3:27AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HEAT INDEX VALUES BETWEEN 105 AND 109 DEGREES ARE EXPECTED TODAY... The combination of warm temperatures and high dewpoints will produce heat indices between 105 and 109 degrees today. Residents with outdoor activities planned are urged to drink plenty of water, wear light weight and light colored clothing and take frequent breaks from the heat. Young children and pets should never be left

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 11 at 3:12AM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Fog Reducing Visibility... Areas of fog, locally dense, will continue this morning. Visibility will be reduced to a quarter of a mile or less in some locations, and this could impact the morning commute. This includes areas along the Interstate 70 corridor. Use caution if traveling this morning.
